page.title: 2014 kidnapping and murder of Israeli teenagers

{{pp-30-500|small=yes}} {{lead too long|date=August 2015}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2014}} {{Infobox event |title = 2014 kidnapping and murder of Israeli teenagers |image = Eyal Yifrach, Gilad Shaar, Naftali Frenkel.jpg |image_size = |caption = Eyal Yifrach, Gilad Shaar, Naftali Fraenkel |date = {{start date|df=yes|2014|06|12}} |time = Approximately 22:00 [[Israel Summer Time|IDT]] ([[UTC+03:00]]) |place = [[Gush Etzion]], the [[West Bank]] |outcome = The three kidnapped teenagers were murdered and their bodies found on 30 June. |reported deaths = Naftali Fraenkel, 16, from [[Nof Ayalon]]
Gilad Shaer, 16, from [[Talmon]]
Eyal Yifrah, 19, from [[El'ad]] |suspects = 2 [[Hamas]] members from [[Hebron]]: Marwan Qawasmeh (29) and Amar Abu-Isa/Amer Abu Aysha (32){{cite news|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/israel-ids-2-main-suspects-in-teens-disappearance|title=Israel IDs 2 main suspects in teens disappearance |publisher=[[CBS News]]|date=26 June 2014}} |accused = |convicted = |charges = |verdict = |convictions = |litigation = |notes = }} On 12 June 2014, three [[Israel]]i teenagers were kidnapped at the bus/[[Hitchhiking in Israel|hitchhiking stop]] at the [[Israeli settlement]] of [[Alon Shvut]] in [[Gush Etzion]], in the [[West Bank]], as they were [[hitchhiking]] to their homes. The three teens were Naftali Frenkel (16, from [[Nof Ayalon]]), Gilad Shaer (16, from [[Talmon]]), and Eyal Yifrah (19, from [[Elad]]).{{cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/1.598583|title=Live Blog: Netanyahu says three teens kidnapped by terror organization |date=15 June 2014|work=[[Haaretz]]|accessdate=15 June 2014}} Gilad Shaer called a police emergency hotline to report the kidnapping. The emergency call recording, initially under a [[gag order]], was leaked to the public. After Shaer's whispered message "They kidnapped me", the taped call also recorded shouting in Arabic from the kidnappers and several volleys of automatic gunfire. Within days, Israeli investigators, though lacking conclusive proof, strongly suspected the teenagers had been killed, and, if so, knew where the victims' bodies would probably have been dumped.Harel, Amos & Yaniv Kubovich, [http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/.premium-1.602281 "Revealed: Behind the scenes on the hunt to find kidnapped teens"], ''[[Haaretz]]'', 1 July 2014.[[Jonathan Freedland]],[http://www.nybooks.com/blogs/nyrblog/2014/jul/26/liberal-zionism-after-gaza/?insrc=rel Liberal Zionism After Gaza"], ''[[New York Review of Books]]'', 26 July 2014; ''"Few of these campaigners knew that the Israeli authorities had, in fact, established from the start that the boys were dead and apparently withheld that information from the public."'' [[File:IBrother's Keeper Operation in Judea & Samaria (14234161827).jpg|thumb|300px|IDF's [[Nahal Brigade]] conducting a search in the Hebron area]] The [[Israel Defense Forces]] initiated '''Operation Brother's Keeper''' ({{lang-he|מבצע שובו אחים}}, ''Mivtza Shuvu Ahim'') in search of the three teenagers.{{cite news|url=http://www.algemeiner.com/2014/06/17/idf-seizes-hundreds-of-weapons-in-nablus-as-operation-brother%E2%80%99s-keeper-enters-5th-day-video/|title=IDF Seizes Hundreds of Weapons in Nablus, as Operation 'Brother's Keeper' Enters 5th Day|date=17 June 2014|work=[[Algemeiner Journal]]|accessdate=7 July 2014}} As part of the operation, in the following 11 days Israel arrested around 350 Palestinians,{{cite news|first=Raphael|last=Ahren|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/is-israels-operation-to-find-kidnapped-teens-a-war-crime|title=Is Israel's operation to find kidnapped teens a war crime?|newspaper=[[The Times of Israel]]|date=23 June 2014}}{{cite news|first=Yoav|last=Zitun |url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4531266,00.html|title=Operation Bring Back Our Brothers: IDF arrests 200, shift focus to Nablus|publisher=[[Ynetnews]]|date=17 June 2014}} including nearly all of [[Hamas]]' West Bank leaders.{{cite news|date=16 June 2014|title=Watch: West Bank Hamas leadership in Israeli custody|url=http://www.jpost.com/Pillar-of-Defense/Entire-Hamas-leadership-in-West-Bank-in-Israeli-custody-some-may-be-deported-359462|work=The Jerusalem Post}} Five Palestinians were killed during the military operation.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/jun/26/hunt-missing-israeli-boys-recriminations|title=Hunt for missing Israeli boys stirs up familiar recriminations|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|date=26 June 2014}}Hend Kortam, [http://www.dailynewsegypt.com/2014/07/03/murder-palestinian-teen-abu-khudeir-condemned/ 'Murder of Palestinian teen, Abu Khudeir, condemned,'] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714190919/http://www.dailynewsegypt.com/2014/07/03/murder-palestinian-teen-abu-khudeir-condemned/ |date=14 July 2014 }} [[Daily News Egypt]] 3 July 2014.{{cite news|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/2/8/105345/World/Region/Israel-commited-serious-violations-in-West-Bank-op.aspx|title=Israel committed serious violations in West Bank operations: HRW|work=[[Al-Ahram]]|date=3 July 2014}}{{cite news|url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/pti-stories/1-wounded-as-israel-arrests-10-palestinians-in-west-bank-114062600717_1.html|title=1 wounded as Israel arrests 10 Palestinians in West Bank|work=[[Business Standard]]|date=26 June 2014}} On 15 June, Israeli Prime Minister [[Benjamin Netanyahu]] said that the teens had been kidnapped by Hamas,{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2014/06/15/world/meast/west-bank-jewish-teens-missing|title=Israeli PM Netanyahu says Hamas abducted 3 teenagers|date=15 June 2014|work=[[CNN]]}}{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/israel/10901225/Hamas-kidnapping-Islamist-group-to-blame-for-youths-kidnapping-Benjamin-Netanyahu-says.html|title=Hamas kidnapping: Islamist group to blame for youths' 'kidnapping', Benjamin Netanyahu says|author=Robert Tait|newspaper=The Telegraph|date=15 June 2014}} which Hamas denied. Palestinian president [[Mahmoud Abbas]] maintained that as of 22 June there was no evidence that Hamas was behind the kidnapping.{{cite web|title=No Proof of Hamas involved in Israeli teens kidnapping: Mahmoud Abbas|date=22 June 2014|url=http://news.biharprabha.com/2014/06/no-proof-of-hamas-involved-in-israeli-teens-kidnapping-mahmoud-abbas|publisher=Bihar Prabha|accessdate=22 June 2014}} On 25 July, [[BBC News|BBC]] [[List of BBC newsreaders and reporters|correspondent Jon Donnison]] tweeted that Israeli police spokesman [[Mickey Rosenfeld]] stated that the kidnappings did not occur on the orders of, or with the knowledge of the Hamas leadership, and that the crime was the action of a "lone cell".[http://www.dailystar.com.lb/News/Middle-East/2014/Jul-26/265229-hamas-not-complicit-in-teens-kidnap-israeli-police.ashx "Hamas not complicit in teens’ kidnap: Israeli police"], ''[[The Daily Star (Lebanon)|The Daily Star]]'', 26 July 2014; "Israeli police spokes Mickey Rosenfeld also said if kidnapping had been ordered by Hamas leadership, they'd have known about it in advance."Katie Zavadski, [http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2014/07/hamas-didnt-kidnap-the-israeli-teens-after-all.html "It Turns Out Hamas May Not Have Kidnapped and Killed the 3 Israeli Teens After All"], ''[[New York (magazine)|New York Magazine]]'', 25 July 2014.Peter Walker, Tom McCarthy [https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2014/jul/25/gaza-crisis-israel-strike-un-shelter-palestinian-protesters-west-bank-live-updates "Gaza crisis: Kerry says ceasefire deal remains out of reach"], ''[[The Guardian]]'', 25 July 2014; [5:45 pm]: "'Israeli police MickeyRosenfeld tells me men who killed 3 Israeli teens def lone cell, hamas affiliated but not operating under leadership", Donnison tweets' [[Buzzfeed|Sheera Frenkel]] had reported similar views from Israel and Palestinian sources some ten days earlier.[[Buzzfeed|Sheera Frenkel]], [https://www.buzzfeed.com/sheerafrenkel/who-was-behind-the-kidnapping-of-three-israeli-teens-and-why "Who Was Behind The Kidnapping Of Three Israeli Teens, And Why Are They So Hard To Find?"], Buzzfeed, 15 Jun 2014; "The kidnapping of three Israeli teenagers was likely carried out by a small group of militants with no direct orders from Hamas, ISIS, or any other regional terror group, said senior Israeli and Palestinian officials Sunday ... For years, Israeli officials have warned that there was a rising threat from individuals carrying out terror attacks without the assistance of an organized group. Those attacks, they added, were harder to defend against as there was often no intelligence warning leading up to the attack. "What we do know, is that this was likely an opportunistic move. The men behind this may have ties to a larger terror group, but this does not have the markings of a well-planned, complex operation.".' Rosenfeld later denied having used the words "lone cell".Batya Ungar-Sargon, [http://www.tabletmag.com/scroll/180617/did-israel-say-hamas-didnt-kidnap-its-teens-no "Did Israel Say Hamas Didn’t Kidnap Its Teens? No."], ''[[Tablet magazine|Tablet]]'', 28 July 2014. On 5 August, Israel said that it had arrested Hussam Qawasmeh, a cousin of Marwan Qawasmeh, on 11 July, who is suspected of having organized the killing of the three teenagers. According to court documents, Qawasmeh stated that Hamas members in [[Gaza Strip|Gaza]] financed the recruitment and arming of the killers.{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/palestinian-suspect-held-over-kidnap-murders-3-israelis-232132557.html|title=Palestinian suspect held over kidnap murders of 3 Israelis: police|publisher=Yahoo! News|date=2014-08-05|accessdate=2014-08-06}}{{cite web|last=Rabinovitch|first=Ari|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/08/05/us-mideast-gaza-arrests-idUSKBN0G529N20140805|title=Israel says it has arrested suspect in killing of 3 teenagers|publisher=Reuters|date=2014-08-05|accessdate=2014-08-06}} Hussam Qawasmeh's lawyers stated that he confessed under "heavy torture" from Israeli security services, [[Shin Bet]]. Qawasmeh's lawyer stated "What he said during interrogation was that he was responsible for ordering the kidnapping", and that "[t]he orders came from him personally."[https://www.buzzfeed.com/sheerafrenkel/israel-releases-details-of-hamas-cell-accused-of-kidnapping "Israel Releases Details Of Hamas Cell Accused Of Kidnapping And Killing Three Israeli Teens"], ''Buzzfeed''; retrieved 7 August 2014. On 26 June, the [[Israel Security Agency]] released the identities of two Hamas suspects in the kidnapping.{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2014/06/26/world/meast/israel-kidnapped-teenagers-hamas|title=Israeli authorities identify the suspects in teens' kidnapping|publisher=[[CNN]]|accessdate=29 June 2014|first1=Shelby Lin|last1=Erdman}} Both ISA and Palestinian authorities said that the two men have been missing since the night of the kidnapping, and the ISA stated that both had engaged in terrorism, been arrested, and served time in the past, and were considered suspects immediately after the kidnapping. A senior Palestinian intelligence official said off the record that their disappearance constituted clear evidence the two suspects have links with the abduction. On 30 June, search teams found the bodies of the three missing teenagers in a field north-west of [[Hebron]].{{cite news|title=Bodies of three kidnapped Israeli teens found in West Bank|url=http://www.jpost.com/Operation-Brothers-Keeper/Large-number-of-IDF-forces-gather-north-of-Hebron-in-search-for-kidnapped-teens-361048|work=The Jerusalem Post|date=30 June 2014}}{{cite news|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4536378,00.html|title=Security forces find missing teens' bodies in West Bank|publisher=[[Ynetnews]]|accessdate=30 June 2014}} They had apparently been shot dead shortly after the abduction.{{cite news|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/bodies-of-three-kidnapped-teens-found|title=Bodies of three kidnapped teens found|newspaper=[[The Times of Israel]]|date=30 June 2014}} Prime Minister [[Benjamin Netanyahu]] vowed a tough response to the killings.{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/middle_east/three-kidnapped-israeli-teenagers-found-dead-reports-say/2014/06/30/4e6a271a-007a-11e4-8572-4b1b969b6322_story.html|title=Israeli army says three kidnapped teenagers found dead|work=The Washington Post|date=30 June 2014|accessdate=30 June 2014|last=Eglash|first=Ruth|author2=William Branigin}} On 20 August 2014, a [[Hamas]] official [[Saleh al-Arouri|Salah al-Arouri]], who had been publicly identified as the mastermind of the operation several days after the kidnapping, on 19 June, said that the organization's armed wing, the [[Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades]], was behind the kidnapping and murder.{{cite news|title=In first, Hamas official takes credit for kidnap and murder of Israeli teens|url=http://www.jpost.com/Arab-Israeli-Conflict/In-first-Hamas-official-takes-credit-for-kidnap-and-murder-of-Israeli-teens-371703|accessdate=20 August 2014|publisher=The Jerusalem Post}}{{cite news|last1=Kais|first1=Roi|title=Hamas admits to kidnapping three Israeli teens|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4561387,00.html|accessdate=20 August 2014|publisher=YNET}}{{cite web|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/1.611676|title=Hamas claims responsibility for three Israeli teens' kidnapping and murder|date=21 August 2014|work=Haaretz.com|accessdate=23 September 2014}}[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/israel/11048705/Hamas-kidnapped-three-teenagers-leading-figure-says.html Hamas kidnapped three teenagers, leading figure says] The Telegraph Retrieved 22 August 2014{{cite news|title=Hamas official admits group abducted, killed Israeli teens|url=http://www.foxnews.com/world/2014/08/21/hamas-official-admits-group-orchestrated-abductions-and-killings-israeli-teens/|accessdate=22 August 2014|agency=Fox News}} The Shin Bet had been investigating him in the belief that he ran a major Hamas network in the West Bank, headed by Riad Nasser of [[Deir Qadis]], near Ramallah, and that he was behind the kidnapping. Following this line of investigation may have delayed the capture of Hussam al-Qarasme, who was only arrested on 10 July. al-Arouri, one of the founders of Hamas's military wing, made his comments at a conference in Istanbul, where he lives in exile.[https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/aug/21/hamas-kidnapping-three-israeli-teenagers-saleh-al-arouri-qassam-brigades Hamas official: we were behind the kidnapping of three Israeli teenagers], ''The Guardian''; retrieved 21 August 2014 The Israeli Defense establishment thinks that Arouri is unconnected with the kidnapping, and was boasting. Hamas leader [[Khaled Mashal]] said that some Hamas members had kidnapped and murdered the Israeli teens but stated that they were not acting on orders from the Hamas leadership, which he said, were "not aware of this action taken by this group of Hamas members in advance" and the first he heard about it was through the Israeli investigation into the events.{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/hamas-leader--don-t-compare-us-to-isil-193125056.html|title=Hamas leader: Don't compare us to ISIL|date=22 August 2014|work=Yahoo News|accessdate=23 September 2014}}[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4562328,00.html Mashal: Hamas was behind murder of three Israeli teens], Ynetnews.com; retrieved 23 August 2014[http://www.timesofisrael.com/mashaal-admits-hamas-members-killed-israeli-teens Mashaal admits Hamas members killed Israeli teens] The Times of Israel Retrieved 23 August 2014{{cite news|last1=Mullen|first1=Jethro|title=Hamas admits its men abducted Israeli teens, says its leaders didn't know|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2014/08/22/world/meast/mideast-crisis/index.html?hpt=hp_t2|accessdate=23 August 2014|agency=CNN}} Meshaal, who has headed Hamas' exiled political wing since 2004, has denied being involved in the "details" of Hamas "military issues".{{cite web|last=Isikoff|first=Michael|url=https://news.yahoo.com/in-personal-plea--top-hamas-leader-calls-on-obama-to-stop--holocaust--in-gaza-180315615.html|title=In personal plea, top Hamas leader calls on Obama to stop 'holocaust' in Gaza|publisher=Yahoo! News|date=25 August 2014|accessdate=20 September 2016}} He praised the kidnappers hoping the action could lead to the release of Palestinian prisoners.{{cite web|last=Levy|first=Elior|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4533751,00.html|title=Mashal praises kidnappers, says Hamas has no information|publisher=Ynet News|date=23 June 2014|accessdate=20 September 2016}} According to [[J.J. Goldberg]], the military indictment contains no evidence of orders from Hamas itself and strengthens the thesis that the incident was organized by the Qawasmeh family alone from start to finish.[http://blogs.forward.com/jj-goldberg/205246/kidnap-plotter-indicted-still-looks-like-lone-cel/? "Kidnap Plotter Indicted: Still Looks Like 'Lone Cell'"], ''[[The Forward]]'', 5 September 2014. According to Amos Harel and Chaim Levinson, the kidnappers planned to wait a few days, then contact senior Hamas operatives in the [[Hebron]] area, to manage the hostage and negotiate a prisoner swap with Israel. In their view it appears doubtful that any senior Hamas official would have been ready to accept that kind of risk. On 23 September 2014, after Israel killed the two suspects, Marwan Qawasmeh and Amar Abu-Isa (aka Amer Abu Aysha) in a shootout, IDF Chief Lt. Gen. [[Benny Gantz]] announced that Operation Brother's Keeper "has come to an end."[http://www.jpost.com/Breaking-News/Gantz-Operation-Brothers-Keeper-has-come-to-an-end-376127 "Gantz: Operation Brothers Keeper has come to an end"], ''The Jerusalem Post'', 23 September 2014. On 6 January 2015, Hussam Qawasmeh, a member of Hamas, was jailed and sentenced to three life terms in prison for the murders. He must also pay $63,000 in compensation to the victims' families.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-30697521|title=Palestinian jailed for murder of Israeli teenagers|author=BBC|date=6 January 2015}} {{TOC limit|3}} ==Background== 2013 was a calm period with the November 2012 ceasefire being largely respected, despite 50 rockets fired by Palestinians and 10 airstrikes by Israel.{{cite web|url=https://unispal.un.org/UNISPAL.NSF/0/26E6B78156B58A9985257CB70065223F|title=Human Rights and Democracy Report 2013|date=10 April 2014|publisher=UK Foreign and Commonwealth Office|access-date=28 June 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150510060215/http://unispal.un.org/UNISPAL.NSF/0/26E6B78156B58A9985257CB70065223F|archive-date=10 May 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} According to PCHR 44 Palestinians were killed and over 100 injured,{{cite web|url= http://www.pchrgaza.org/files/2014/annual%20English%202013.pdf |title=PCHR Annual Report 2013}} while the Israeli Security Agency reported six Israeli fatalities (all but one from the West Bank) and 44 injuries.{{cite web|url= http://www.shabak.gov.il/English/EnTerrorData/Reports/Pages/2013AnnualSummary.aspx |title= 2013 Annual Summary | publisher=Israel Security Agency|year=2013}} The first half of 2014 saw an increase in tension manifested by a higher rate of injuries. Among Palestinians there were 43 fatalities in the first half of the year plus 1860 injuries.{{cite web|url= http://www.ochaopt.org/documents/ocha_opt_protection_of_civilians_weekly_report_2014_7_11_english.pdf|title=WEEKLY REPORT 1 – 7 JULY 2014|publisher=OCHAO|year=2006}} Tension was also increased by Israel's opposition to the formation of a Hamas-Fatah unity government, with threats of sanctions{{cite web|url= http://www.latimes.com/world/middleeast/la-fg-hamas-palestinian-government-20140602-story.html |title= New Palestinian government backed by Hamas; Israel threatens sanctions |author= Maher Abukhater and Batsheva Sobelman| publisher=Los Angeles Times |date=2 June 2014}} and the burgeoning issue of prisoners and the violation of the Shalit agreement{{cite web|url=http://www.addameer.org/etemplate.php?id=701 |title=Update on Hunger Strikes, Force Feeding & Arrest Campaign - June 2014 |publisher=Addameer |date=June 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714161649/http://www.addameer.org/etemplate.php?id=701 |archivedate=14 July 2014 }}[[Nathan Thrall]], [http://www.lrb.co.uk/v36/n16/nathan-thrall/hamass-chances "Hamas’s Chances"], ''[[London Review of Books]]'' Vol. 36 No 16 • 21 August 2014 (1 August) pp. 10–12{{cite news|url=https://www.economist.com/news/middle-east-and-africa/21607895-hamas-wants-two-big-concessions-it-may-not-get-them-why-hamas-fires-those-rockets|title=Conditions for a ceasefire: Why Hamas fires those rockets|publisher=The Economist|accessdate=22 July 2014}} Mutual attacks on each other by Israel and Gaza continued, as did the Israeli blockade of Gaza.{{cite web|url=http://www.worldbulletin.net/haber/139114/israeli-air-land-and-sea-assaults-on-palestinians-continue|title=Israeli air, land and sea assaults on Palestinians continue|publisher=World Bulletin|date=17 June 2014}} Mainstream western media ascribe the initiation of the major 2014 conflict to the kidnapping of the three Israeli teenagers.{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2014/07/15/world/middleeast/toll-israel-gaza-conflict.html?_r=0|title=The Toll in Gaza and Israel, Day by Day|author=Karen Yourish and Josh Keller|publisher=New York Times|date=15 July 2014}} Some news analysts believe that earlier clashes might also have played a role in the chain of events. On 15 May, two Palestinian teenagers were shot dead during the Nakba commemorations in the [[Beitunia killings]]. An autopsy report published on 9 June proved the death of one of them to be due to "live fire", i.e. not rubber bullets."{{cite web|url= https://www.hrw.org/news/2014/06/09/israel-killing-children-apparent-war-crime|title=Israel: Killing of Children Apparent War Crime|date=9 June 2014|publisher=Human Rights Watch}}{{cite web|url=http://mondoweiss.net/2014/07/moyheldin-relates-palestinian|title=Violence ecalates in Israel and Gaza|author=Phil Weiss and Annie Robbins|publisher=MSNBC|year=2014}}{{cite web|url= http://www.aljazeera.com/indepth/opinion/2014/07/israel-dominant-media-narrative-20147675736829395.html|title=Israel's dominant media narrative|author=Rachel Shabi|publisher=Al Jazeera|date=6 July 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://www.pij.org/details.php?blog=1&id=305|title=Hopelessness as Luxury: Perspectives from Contested Jerusalem|author=Christine Leuenberger|work=Palestine-Israel Journal quarterly|date=23 September 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://www.informationclearinghouse.info/article39102.htm|title=When Does the 'Cycle of Violence' Start?|author=Aldo Guerrero| publisher=Information Clearing House|date=15 July 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://www.msnbc.com/all-in/watch/violence-escalates-in-israel-and-gaza-299841091970|title=All In with Chris Hayes|date=8 July 2014|publisher=MSNBC}}[[Ilan Pappé]], [http://www.pipr.co.uk/all/the-historical-perspective-of-the-2014-gaza-massacre "The Historical Perspective of the 2014 Gaza Massacre"], ''The Plymouth Institute for Peace Research'', 21 August 2014. The Israeli Foreign Ministry web site emphasizes rocket fire from Gaza as being the reason for the IDF war on Gaza.{{cite web|url=http://mfa.gov.il/MFA/PressRoom/2014/Pages/Statement-by-PM-Netanyahu-8-July-2014.aspx|title=Statement by PM Netanyahu|publisher=Israel Ministry of Foreign Affairs|year=2014}}{{cite web|url=http://mfa.gov.il/MFA/PressRoom/2014/Pages/FM-Liberman-dispatches-letter-to-foreign-ministers-9-July-2014.aspx|title=FM Liberman dispatches letter to foreign ministers|author=A. Lieberman|publisher=Israel Ministry of Foreign Affairs|year=2014}} == Victims == Eyal Yifrach, 19, lived in [[El'ad]],{{citation needed|date=September 2015}} Naftali Fraenkel (also spelled Frenkel), 16, was a dual Israeli-American citizen and lived in [[Nof Ayalon]].{{citation needed|date=September 2015}} Gilad Shaer was a resident of the [[Israeli settlement]] of [[Talmon]].{{citation needed|date=September 2015}} Eyal Yifrah was a student at the {{Interlanguage link multi|Shavei Hevron Yeshiva|he|3=שבי חברון}} on King David Street in Hebron.{{cite news |first=Mitch |last=Ginsburg |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/yeshiva-of-missing-teen-eyal-yifrach-opens-its-doors/ |title=Pain and brotherhood at kidnap victim's Hebron yeshiva |newspaper=[[The Times of Israel]] |date=19 June 2014}} The other two were students of the [[Adin Steinsaltz|Mekor Chaim yeshiva]] at [[Kfar Etzion]] in the [[West Bank]]'s [[West Bank Areas in the Oslo II Accord|Area C]] under full Israeli administration.{{cite news |url=http://www.theyeshivaworld.com/news/headlines-breaking-stories/239752/the-terrorist-abduction-search-continues.html |title=The Terrorist Abduction Search Continues |newspaper=[[Yeshiva World News]] |date=15 June 2014}} ==Suspects== ===Initial suspected perpetrators=== Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu stated that Hamas killed the teenagers. But opinions were divided within Israel's security services as to whether or not the two suspects had direct ties to Hamas.Sheera Frenkel, [https://www.buzzfeed.com/sheerafrenkel/three-kidnapped-israeli-teens-are-found-dead "Three Kidnapped Israeli Teens Are Found Dead"], ''[[BuzzFeed]]'', 30 June 2014. On 26 June, the Israel Security Agency identified two Hamas members as key suspects in the kidnapping, whom Palestinian police noted, had gone missing since the night of the kidnapping.{{cite news|place=UK|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/israel/10929615/Israel-identifies-two-suspects-in-case-of-kidnapped-teens.html|title=Israel identifies two suspects in case of kidnapped teens|work=The Telegraph|accessdate=29 June 2014}} High-ranking members of Hamas denied that the group had any involvement or foreknowledge of the incident. The two named suspects hail from the [[Qawasameh tribe|Qawasameh clan]], notorious for consistently acting against Hamas's policies and its attempts to reach an entente {{dubious|date=September 2016}} with Israel.Shlomi Eldar, [https://web.archive.org/web/20140630191535/http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2014/06/qawasmeh-clan-hebron-hamas-leadership-mahmoud-abbas.html "Accused kidnappers are actually rogue Hamas branch"], ''[[Al-Monitor]]'', 29 June 2014. Hamas political chief [[Khaled Meshal]] said he could neither confirm nor deny the kidnapping of the three Israelis, and he congratulated the abductors, because "our prisoners must be freed from the prisons of the occupation".{{cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/1.600759#!|title=Hamas chief lauds abductors of Israeli teens, says has no new information|work=Haaretz|accessdate=23 June 2014}} Initially a number of groups, some previously unknown, claimed responsibility for the kidnappings: The [[Al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigades]] (subsequently denied);{{cite press release|url=http://www.amnesty.ie/news/public-statementabducted-israeli-teens-must-be-released-israel-must-cease-collective-punishment |title=Abducted Israeli teens must be released, Israel must cease collective punishment of Palestinians |publisher=[[Amnesty International]] |place=[[Ireland|IE]] |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141004001043/http://amnesty.ie/news/public-statementabducted-israeli-teens-must-be-released-israel-must-cease-collective-punishment |archivedate=4 October 2014 |df= }} a West Bank Branch of [[Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant]], ''Brigades of Global Jihad'', ''Ahrar ar-Khalil'' (Liberators Battalion of Hebron), and ''Regiments of Hezbollah''.{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/middle_east/israel-searches-for-teens-who-went-missing-in-the-west-bank-on-thursday/2014/06/14/d60a0778-f3df-11e3-a4a8-8ac203a4c406_story.html|title=Israel says 3 missing teens were kidnapped by a terrorist group|date=14 June 2014|work=[[The Washington Post]]|accessdate=15 June 2014}}{{cite news|first=Yoav|last=Zitun|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4534855,00.html|title=IDF arrests 10 Palestinians amid signs of that hunt for teens drawing down|publisher=[[Ynetnews]] |date=26 June 2014}} It was not clear how true their claims were, and the middle three were not considered credible. ===Suspects arrest=== After the kidnap of the Israeli teens, Israel commenced Operation Brother's Keeper in the West Bank. Israel killed 9 Palestinians and raided 1300 properties including commercial and residential buildings. 800 Palestinians were arrested without charge or trial.[http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/mehdi-hasan/gaza-israel_b_5624401.html Debunking Israel's 11 Main Myths About Gaza, Hamas and War Crimes] Huffington Post Retrieved 23 August 2014 On 5 August 2014 Israel announced that Israeli security forces arrested Hussam Kawasme, in [[Shuafat]], in connection with the murders.{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/World/Middle-East/Kidnap-and-murder-of-Israeli-teens-Palestinian-suspect-held-police-say/articleshow/39719757.cms|title=Kidnap and murder of Israeli teens: Palestinian suspect held, police say|work=The Times of India|accessdate=23 September 2014}} During interrogation, Kawasme admitted to being the mastermind behind the attack, in addition to securing the funding from Hamas.{{cite web|url=http://www.therakyatpost.com/world/2014/08/06/palestinian-suspect-held-kidnap-murders-3-israelis/|title=Palestinian suspect held over kidnap murders of 3 Israelis|work=The Rakyat Post|accessdate=23 September 2014}} Kawasme stated that after the boys were killed, Marwan Kawasme and Amer Abu Aysha drove to his house, and they proceeded to bury them in Halhoul, the land Kawasme purchased only a few weeks prior.{{cite web|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/hamas-funded-kidnapping-of-3-boys-says-ringleader/|title=Hamas funded killing of 3 teens, says ringleader|work=The Times of Israel|accessdate=23 September 2014}} By the time of his arrest, Kaswasme had shaved his beard and received a fake passport, in what is believed to be, part of a plan to escape to Jordan.{{cite web|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/183758#.U-J8xmJdXDg|title=Security Forces Arrest Kidnapper of Israeli Teens - Defense/Security - News - Arutz Sheva|work=Arutz Sheva|accessdate=23 September 2014}} Officials have stated that additional people arrested in connection with the murders are still being held, but no names have been released.{{cite web|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/israel-arrests-suspected-ringleader-of-cell-that-nabbed-teens/|title=Israel arrests suspected ringleader of cell that killed teens|work=The Times of Israel|accessdate=23 September 2014}} On 20 August, Hamas member Saleh al-Arouri, who lives in Turkey, claimed Hamas' involvement in the abduction and murder, according to an Israeli channel 2 translation. He continued on calling the men who perpetrated the act heroic.{{cite news|title=Hamas Leadership Acknowledges Responsibility for Kidnapping Three Israeli Teens|url=http://www.memritv.org/clip/en/4437.htm|accessdate=21 August 2014|publisher=Memri T.V.}} Hugh Lovatt of the [[European Council on Foreign Relations]] said al-Arouri's claim was "suspicious": it might reflect a desire to assert his relevance within the Hamas leadership or it may be true, and reflect a power struggle within Hamas itself. On 21 August Hamas leader [[Khaled Mashal]] claimed Hamas leadership had no prior knowledge of the abductions and murders and had learned about them through the Israeli military. The following day, NGO [[Shurat HaDin]], contacted US Attorney General Eric Holder to request extradition of al-Arouri. Although Turkey and Israel do not have an extradition agreement, the US and Turkey do, which it can use to extradite those who commit terrorists acts against US citizens.{{cite web|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/184277#.U_Yl32JdXDg|title=NGO Asks US to Demand Extradition of Hamas Leader|work=Arutz Sheva|accessdate=23 September 2014}} ===Suspects killings=== The two suspects Marwan Kawasme and Amar Abu Aysha were staying in a house in Hebron when IDF soldiers and Israeli counter-terrorism members, [[Yamam]], surrounded the building at dawn on 23 September in an attempt to arrest the suspects. Israeli forces opened fire on the building and reportedly called on the two suspects to come out. With no response the Israeli force began using a bulldozer to bring down the building. According to Israeli forces, they shot one of the men as his head rose out of a hole and began firing a rifle. After this man fell back into the home, likely dead, Israeli forces again opened fire on the house, utilizing grenades and other explosives this time, killing both men.{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4574284,00.html|title=Inside the raid on teens' killers|publisher=Ynet News|date=23 September 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Arab-Israeli-Conflict/WATCH-Dramatic-footage-of-Israeli-SWAT-team-killing-Palestinian-murderers-of-three-Jewish-teens-376210|title=WATCH: Dramatic footage of Israeli SWAT team hunting Palestinian murderers of three Jewish teens|publisher=Jerusalem Post|accessdate=23 October 2014}} Hebron governor Kamel Hmeid and Hamas spokesman Salah Bardawil both called the suspects martyrs.{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/09/23/us-palestinians-israel-idUSKCN0HI09H20140923|title=Israel says its troops kill Hamas men accused of slaying teens|work=Reuters|accessdate=23 October 2014}}{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/israeli-forces-kill-2-suspects-in-kidnap-murder-of-3-teens/2014/09/23/1e79414a-4304-11e4-b47c-f5889e061e5f_story.html|title=Israeli forces kill two Hamas members suspected in kidnapping, killing of 3 teens|work=Washington Post|accessdate=23 October 2014}} Hamas leader Khaled Mashal also called the suspects "martyrs" and "heroes".{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4583490,00.html|title='Mohammed Deif is alive, and we have proof,' says Mashal|work=ynet|accessdate=23 October 2014}} ===Investigation conclusion=== The investigation concluded that the kidnapping operation's costs ran to [[New Israeli Shekel|NIS]]220,000, a sum procured by Hossam Hassan Kawasmeh (40), with the assistance of his brother, Mahmoud, who was exiled to the Gaza Strip in the Gilad Shalit exchange in November 2011, to purchase the two vehicles and weaponry. The cars were purchased from Nuh Abu-Eisha, the weapons from Hamas operative Adnan Mahmad Izzat Zru (34) both Hebronites. His attempt to escape to Jordan, thwarted when he was arrested in the Shuafat refugee camp on 11 July, was assisted by his relatives Hisham Kawasmeh (45), Jamil Kawasmeh (38) and Hassan Kawasmeh (45) a Hamas militant. Two other Hebronites, Ahmad Ibrahim Mahmad Kawasmeh (64) and his brother, senior Hamas operative Arafat Ibrahim Mahmad Kawasmeh (50) for assistance in going into hiding, and the latter concealed them on his property.[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4567528,00.html ‘Abduction of 3 Israeli teens cost NIS 220,000,'] [[Ynet]] 4 September 2014. On 6 January 2015, Hussam Qawasmeh was sentenced to three life terms in prison for the murders as well as a compensation payment of $63,000 to the victims' families. ==Sequence of events== ===Prelude=== According to Israeli investigations, the seizure and killing of the three was organized by Hussam Qawasmeh, who had received $39,000 from his brother Mahmoud in Gaza, via a go-between still at large. The money financed the purchase of three M-16 rifles, a jeep, and the Israeli car, which was bought from a used-car dealer in Hebron after it was stolen from the settlement of [[Tzur Hadassah]]. Altogether, he met with Marwan five or six times before the kidnapping. The plan was to conceal one kidnapped Israeli in Marwan Qawasme's barbershop in Hebron, then transfer him to Marwan's aunt's vacant house. A first attempt on 10 June failed to find any hitchhikers. There was no intention to release the boys: from the outset the plan, considered amateurish and not professional, envisaged murdering the captives. The plot of land where they were buried had been purchased to that end some time earlier, and a refuge to escape detection had been prepared in an old house near Tufah where the two suspects hid in a disused cesspit for five days.Chaim Levinson, [http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/.premium-1.612132 'Israeli teens’ kidnappers evaded army, hid in cesspool after murders,'] [[Haaretz]] 23 August 2014. The car for the kidnapping had been stolen. ===Week 1 (12–19 June)=== Netanyahu asserted that the attack originated from [[Palestinian National Authority|PA-controlled areas]], and criticized the [[2014 Fatah–Hamas Gaza Agreement|Fatah-Hamas pact]].{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ILyLLxXx9Ow&feature=player_detailpage#t=70|title=PM Netanyahu's Statement Regarding the Kidnapping of Israeli Teenagers by Hamas|publisher=Israeli Prime Minister |format=Google [[YouTube]] |work=Official channel}} In the first week, Israel added a further three to the six [[Brigade|combat brigades]] already present in the West Bank. Close to 40 [[battalion]]s were engaged in rounding up suspects,{{cite news |first=Yoav |last=Zitun |url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4532597,00.html |title=A night with troops searching for abducted teens |publisher=[[Ynetnews]] |date=20 June 2014}} notably the [[Paratroopers Brigade|Paratroopers' 35th Division]] and the [[Kfir Brigade|Kfir's 900th Division]].{{cite news |first=Yaakov |last=Lappin |url=http://www.jpost.com/Defense/IDF-arrests-80-Hamas-members-in-West-Bank-in-response-to-kidnapping-359354 |title=IDF arrests 80 Hamas members in West Bank in response to kidnapping |newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]] |date=15 June 2014}} Other specialized groups, such as the [[Duvdevan Unit]], the [[Egoz Reconnaissance Unit]] and the [[Unit 669|Airborne Rescue And Evacuation Unit 669]] supplement the search force. [[Elbit Skylark|Skylark mini UAV]] drones were deployed, and the [[Yahalom (IDF)|Yahalom combat engineering unit]] conducted tunnel searches.{{cite news |first=Stuart |last=Winer |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/abducted-teens-likely-still-alive-idf-officer-says/ |title=Abducted teens likely still alive, IDF officer says |newspaper=[[The Times of Israel]] |date=22 June 2014}} Fifty [[Negev Bedouin|Bedouin]] IDF trackers were also used.{{cite news |first=Jodi |last=Rudoren |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/06/24/world/middleeast/bedouin-trackers-hunting-for-clues-to-kidnapped-boys.html |title=Bedouin Trackers Hunting for Israeli Boys |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |date=23 June 2014}} ====Day 1==== Late into the night of Thursday, 12 June, teenagers Yifrach, Fraenkel, and Shaer were waiting at Geva'ot Intersection, west of the settlement of Alon Shvut in the Etzion Bloc south of Jerusalem, soon after 22:15, looking to catch a ride heading west on Route 367 toward Beit Shemesh and from there to locations in central Israel where each of them lived. The kidnappers intended to kidnap one Israeli. Apparently Yifrach, after accepting a ride, waved to the other two to join him. The Palestinians, afraid of giving their identity away if they spoke Hebrew, didn't dare object.Amos Harel and Chaim Levinson, [http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/.premium-1.660854 'One year after West Bank murder-kidnapping: What Israeli security got wrong,'] [[Haaretz]] 12 June 2015. After the car veered off from the declared direction of Ashkelon, the three realized they had been kidnapped and Shaer telephoned the police at 22:25, whispering, "I've been kidnapped."{{cite web|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/what-happened-on-the-night-of-the-kidnapping/#ixzz38tE0htQ0|title=What happened on the night of the kidnapping|work=The Times of Israel|accessdate=23 September 2014}} Eight attempts were made to page the caller's cellphone, without checking its ownership, and his whispered remark was taken to be one of the many pranks that night. No check was made to find out the phone's owner, or whether he was missing. Later, analysis of the tape revealed what the police failed to realize at the time, that the murders had occurred while the hotline operator was listening.{{cite news |first=Marissa |last=Newman |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/portraits-of-a-kidnapper/ |title=Portraits of a kidnapper |newspaper=[[The Times of Israel]] |date=27 June 2014}} Four and a half hours passed before Shaer's family finally phoned the Talmon security coordinator at 3:10 am to inform him their son Gil-Ad had not returned home. Only then did the security establishment take the case seriously, and Shin Bet and the IDF were alerted by the police.{{cite news |first=Amos |last=Harel |url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/.premium-1.598973 |title=Hamas kidnapping reminiscent of Hezbollah |newspaper=[[Haaretz]] |date=16 June 2014}}{{cite news |first=Amos |last=Harel |url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/.premium-1.598835 |title=Analysis: Shin Bet probe finds evidence Hamas involved in West Bank kidnapping |newspaper=[[Haaretz]] |date=15 June 2014}} According to the Palestinian [[Ma'an News Agency]], the army succeeded in tracing the call to the Sanjar region, the last cellphone signal being made at 23:20 in the Hebron area, when Fraenkel's and Shaer's cellphones had been switched off.{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx%3FID%3D704478 |title=Israel deploys heavily near Hebron after disappearance of settlers |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=13 June 2014}}{{cite news |first=Christa Case |last=Bryant |url=http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Middle-East/2014/0618/Israel-s-search-for-kidnapped-teens-What-is-known-so-far-and-what-it-means-video |title=Israel's search for kidnapped teens: What is known so far, and what it means |newspaper=[[Christian Science Monitor]] |date=19 June 2014}} Meanwhile, at 1 a.m. on Friday morning, Marwan knocked on Hussam's door and said, "I've murdered three Jews." A gag order was immediately placed regarding the abduction on Israeli news services (the presumed identities of the kidnappers, acolytes of senior Hamas members, were known almost from the beginning to everyone in Hebron, but kept from the Israeli public).{{cite news |first=Avi |last=Issacharoff |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/with-accomplices-kidnappers-evade-the-shin-bet-for-now/ |title=How did the Shin Bet fail to spot the Hebron kidnap cell in time? |newspaper=[[The Times of Israel]]}}{{cite news |first=Avi |last=Issacharoff |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/leaving-hebron-idf-sees-that-kidnappers-can-just-vanish/ |title=In Hebron, the IDF discovers, it's all too easy to disappear |newspaper=[[The Times of Israel]] |date=27 June 2014}} and, in lieu of concrete details, rumours proliferated.{{cite news |first=Yossi |last=Gurvitz |url=http://www.worldcrunch.com/world-affairs/israeli-hostages-gag-orders-and-social-media/israeli-hostages-social-media-gag-orders-palestinian-people-/c1s16248/ |title=Israeli Hostages, Gag Orders and Social Media |publisher=[[Worldcrunch]] |date=17 June 2014}} Controversy soon raged in Israel over the police delay in reporting the call.{{cite news |first=Ben |last=Hartman |url=http://www.jpost.com/Pillar-of-Defense/One-of-kidnapped-teens-called-police-Weve-been-kidnapped-359396 |title=One of abducted Israeli teens called police: "We've been kidnapped" |newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]] |date=15 June 2014}} At 11:00 on 13 June, a "[[Hannibal Directive|Hannibal]]" alert (meaning 'kidnapping') was issued.{{citation needed|date=August 2014}} Based on cellphone and other data, Israeli investigators deduced that the kidnappers' car had stopped near Beit Kahil, west of Halhul, for 28 minutes. According to Palestinian security sources, a [[Hyundai Tucson|Hyundai i35]], with seating for 5,{{cite news |first=Amos |last=Harel |url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/.premium-1.600407 |title=Don't expect a happy ending from Israel's West Bank operation |newspaper=[[Haaretz]] |date=22 June 2014}} with Israeli license plates, was torched on the night of 12 June, and subsequently found by Palestinian police {{convert|2|km|mi}} from the village of [[Beit Einun]] near Hebron.{{cite news |url=http://forward.com/articles/200049/ |title=Is Torched Car Clue in Suspected Kidnap of 3 Jewish Teens on West Bank? |newspaper=[[The Forward]] |publisher=[[Reuters]] |date=13 June 2014 |quote= As media speculated that the three young settlers might have been abducted, }}{{cite news |first=Peter |last=Beaumont |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/jun/15/israeli-forces-west-bank-abducted-teenagers |title=Israeli forces tighten grip on West Bank in search for three abducted teenagers |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |date=15 June 2014}} This vehicle was believed to be connected to the abduction. The suspicion arose that the use of the car displaying Israeli license plates was a trick to lull the hitchhikers into believing the vehicle was driven by Israelis. The Israeli authorities had placed the emergency call recording under a gag order but it was leaked to the public, after which the gag order was partially lifted. It then emerged that on the first day, after Gilad Shaer's whispered message "They kidnapped me," the taped emergency call also recorded a cry ("heads down!"), sounds of shouting, a volley of automatic fire, a weak voice sighing "Ai," silence, another volley of automatic fire and then singing.{{cite news|title=LISTEN: Recording of kidnapped teen's distress call to police released|url=http://www.jpost.com/Operation-Brothers-Keeper/Recording-of-distress-call-to-police-by-kidnapped-teen-released-361169|publisher=The Jerusalem Post|date=1 July 2014}} The burnt car discovered that morning yielded evidence of numerous blood-stains. Israeli police assumed correctly that bodies must have been buried in that vicinity. What they did not know is that the bodies had been taken from the provisory burial site and reburied {{convert|3|km|mi}} beyond the radius of research. Notwithstanding this, the Israeli authorities began to broadcast the message that the boys were abducted, not that they had been murdered.{{cite news |first=Shlomi |last=Eldar |url=http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2014/07/misleading-kidnapping-almoz-hamas-vengeance-hatred.html |title=Israeli public misled on abductions? |newspaper=[[Al-Monitor]] |date=3 July 2014}}{{cite news |first=Justin |last=Schwegel |url=http://www.atimes.com/atimes/Middle_East/MID-01-080714.html |title=How Israel Turned Tragedy into Opportunity |newspaper=[[Asia Times Online]] |date=8 July 2014}} ====Days 2–3==== On 14–15 June, the Hebron and South Hebron Hills areas were the focus of investigations by a large number of troops. Soldiers numbering 2,500 together with security agents, police, and special forces engaged in a manhunt, scouring numerous villages, including [[Beit Ummar]],{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/ENG/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=705297 |title=3 injured by rubber-coated bullets in Beit Ummar clashes |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=17 June 2014}} Beit Einun, [[Halhul]], [[Dura, Hebron|Dura]], [[as-Samu]], [[Tarqumiyah]], [[Beit Kahil]],{{cite news |first=Tom |last=Rayner |url=http://news.sky.com/story/1282241/israel-searches-for-kidnapped-teen-settlers |title=Israel Searches For 'Kidnapped' Teen Settlers |publisher=[[Sky News]] |date=15 June 2014}} [[Yatta, Hebron|Yatta]],{{cite news |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/torched-car-near-hebron-may-have-served-kidnappers/ |title=Torched car near Hebron may have served kidnappers |newspaper=[[The Times of Israel]] |date=14 June 2014}} [[Taffuh]],{{cite news |url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/.premium-1.599001 |title=Israeli security forces ramp up hunt for Hamas cell in West Bank |newspaper=[[Haaretz]] |date=16 June 2014}}{{cite news |first=Peter |last=Beaumont |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/jun/16/israel-considering-expelling-hamas-leaders-west-bank-gaza |title=Israel Leaders Considering Expelling Hamas Leaders from the West Bank to Gaza |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |date=16 June 2014}} and [[Tapuah]]{{cite news |first=Jack |last=Khoury |url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/.premium-1.599153 |title=Hebron area out of bounds to US officials after kidnapping |newspaper=[[Haaretz]] |date=17 June 2014}} in what the IDF termed 'Operation Shuvu Achim (Return, Brothers/Bring Back Our Brothers),'{{cite news |first=Yoav |last=Zitun |url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4530549,00.html |title=Infantry battalion deployed to Hebron, IDF calls in reservists |publisher=[[Ynetnews]] |date=15 June 2014}} and referred to in English as 'Brother's Keeper'.{{cite news |first=Gideon |last=Levy |author-link=Gideon Levy |url=http://www.haaretz.com/opinion/.premium-1.599667 |title=Israel's double standard |newspaper=[[Haaretz]] |date=19 June 2014}} An anonymous "security source" claimed that little resistance was encountered because the local populations have become accustomed in recent years to regular night raids by the IDF. The sound of rubber-coated bullets and tear-gas canisters were heard. [[File:Brother's Keeper Operation in Judea & Samaria (14413608806).jpg|thumb|IDF troops entering a building to search on 15 June.]] [[File:Palestinian Weapons Exposed During Operation Brother’s Keeper (14256558999).jpg|thumb|Weapons found during Operation Brother's Keeper in Nablus]] Over the weekend, Israeli security forces also arrested around 80 Palestinians, among them senior members of Hamas, accused of being connected to the kidnapping,{{cite news |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/israel-rounds-up-senior-hamas-men-in-the-west-bank/ |title=Israel rounds up senior Hamas men in West Bank sweep|date=15 June 2014|work=[[The Times of Israel]]|accessdate=15 June 2014}} in a sweep that rounded up former government leaders, clerics, university lecturers, and militants of both Hamas and [[Islamic Jihad Movement in Palestine|Islamic Jihad]] across the West Bank.{{cite news |first=William |last=Booth |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/israeli-forces-detain-80-palestinians-in-search-for-kidnapped-teens/2014/06/15/9056ea90-f47d-11e3-8f20-f3a5fed7f3c4_story.html |title=Israel accuses Hamas of abducting 3 teens |newspaper=The [[Washington Post]] |date=15 June 2014}} In Hebron's Ein Deir Baha neighborhood Israeli forces broke down a door, apparently by firing a missile, after surrounding the house of Akram al-Qawasami. He, his 8-year-old son Muhammad and younger daughter Sujoud were injured by shrapnel, and two Hamas operatives, among them Zaid Akram al-Qawasami, were arrested inside.{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.com/Content.aspx?id=705045 |title=3 Palestinians injured after Israeli army 'bombs Hebron home' |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=15 June 2014}} The military also fully closed the [[Hebron Governorate|Hebron area]] and [[Israel–Gaza barrier|Gaza crossings]], only allowing passage for humanitarian cases. On Sunday, Netanyahu said what he had only hinted at previously, that Israel "knew for a fact" that the abduction had been carried out by Hamas,{{cite news |first=Jodi |last=Rudoren |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/06/16/world/middleeast/netanyahu-blames-hamas-in-kidnapping-of-israeli-youths.html |title=Netanyahu Says Three Were Taken by Hamas |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |date=15 June 2014}} a position the IDF had avoided explicitly stating. He did, however, not provide any evidence. Security officials remained more cautious, tending to accept the probability that a Hebronite Hamas cell was involved, but uncertain whether it was a local initiative to secure prisoner releases or an operation approved by the Hamas leadership in Gaza. A remark by [[Moshe Ya'alon]] about the "very heavy price" Hamas leaders might pay was interpreted by one journalist as hinting Israel might be mulling the option of resuming its campaign of [[Targeted killings by Israel Defense Forces|targeted killings]], this time against the Hamas leadership.{{cite news |first=Mitch |last=Ginsburg |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/israel-could-kill-hamas-leaders-defense-minister-hints/ |title=Israel could kill Hamas leaders, defense minister hints |newspaper=[[The Times of Israel]] |date=15 June 2014}} Israel's [[Ministry of Defense (Israel)|Deputy Minister of Defense]], [[Danny Danon]], threatened "possible actions" in [[Gaza City|Gaza]] and [[Ramallah]].{{cite news |date=15 June 2014 |title=Israeli raids target Hamas members as Netanyahu accuses group of kidnapping |url= https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/jun/15/israel-raids-hamas-kipdnapping-netanyahu |newspaper=The Guardian |location=Jerusalem |agency=Associated Press |accessdate=16 June 2014}} ====Day 4==== Overnight on 16 June, the IDF clashed with Palestinians in [[Jenin]], where they ransacked the offices of [[Mustafa Barghouti]]'s [[Palestinian National Initiative]] and confiscated computers,{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=705095 |title=Israeli forces ransack offices, confiscate computers in Jenin |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=16 June 2014}} and 400 soldiers raided the Jalazone refugee camp near [[Ramallah]], killing Ahmad Arafat Samada (Ahmad Sabarin) (21) with a gunshot wound in the chest. The Israeli army said he threw a brick at the Israeli soldiers.{{cite news|title= Israeli forces kill Palestinian during raids|url= http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2014/06/israeli-forces-kill-palestinian-during-raids-201461674729736569.html |publisher=Al Jazeera|date=17 June 2014}}{{cite news|title=Photos of the Day|url=http://www.sfgate.com/news/slideshow/Photos-of-the-Day-87991/photo-6463566.php|agency=AP|work=The San Francisco Chronicle |date=16 June 2014}} A dragnet rounded up a further 50 people, bringing the total of Palestinians detained to 150. Many arrests, including the former speaker of the [[Palestinian Legislative Council]] [[Aziz Duwaik]], 66, were part of what [[Chief of General Staff (Israel)|IDF Chief of Staff]] [[Benny Gantz]] described as an extensive operation, and were not linked to the search for the youths, but were part of a crackdown to apply pressure on Hamas.{{cite news |url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4530816,00.html |title=IDF chief: We're heading towards an extensive operation |publisher=[[Ynetnews]] |date=16 June 2014}}{{cite news |first=Jodi |last=Rudoren |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/06/17/world/middleeast/israel-demands-abbas-help-after-abductions.html |title=Israel Demands Palestinian Leader's Help After Abductions |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |date=16 June 2014}} Netanyahu's approach has been interpreted as aimed at driving a wedge between [[Fatah]] and Hamas in order to break up the reconciliation between the two negotiated in April 2014,{{cite news |first=Amos |last=Harel |url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/.premium-1.599190 |title=Israel's response to kidnapping aimed at driving a wedge between Abbas and Hamas |newspaper=[[Haaretz]] |date=17 June 2014}} and discredit both Abbas and his government, which has been backed by Western countries.{{cite news |first=Daniel |last=Estrin |url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/israel-expands-arrests-search-missing-teens-24169249 |title=Israel Leader Wants World Pressure on Palestinians |newspaper=[[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] News |date=17 June 2014}} PA sources noted that Hamas, in the unity negotiations, had undertaken to desist from attacks and bloodshed, and if its involvement were proven, it would be a breach of the agreement that would render the reconciliation null and void,{{cite news |first=Avi |last=Issacharoff |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/pa-official-unity-pact-is-void-if-hamas-carried-out-kidnapping/ |title=PA official: Unity pact is void if Hamas carried out kidnapping |newspaper=[[The Times of Israel]] |date=16 June 2014}} a point repeated later in the week by the Palestinian Foreign Minister.{{cite news |first=Gregory |last=Blachier |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2014/06/20/uk-palestinian-israel-uprising-idUKKBN0EV19Y20140620 |title=Anger but no uprising over Israeli raids – Palestinian minister |publisher=[[Reuters]] |date=20 June 2014 |quote=if Hamas is behind it, and nobody knows up until now, then it will be a blow to the reconciliation process. If we reach that conclusion, then the president will take drastic decisions.}} [[File:Palestinian Weapons Exposed During Operation Brother’s Keeper (14256563989).jpg|thumb|Weapons found in Nablus during Operation Brother's Keeper on the night of 16 June]] ====Day 5==== Overnight 16–17 June, the [[Israel Defense Forces|IDF]] arrested more than 200 Palestinians. Anything linked to Hamas was being targeted, an official source said.{{cite news |first=Yaakov |last=Lappin |url=http://www.jpost.com/Pillar-of-Defense/Search-for-kidnapped-boys-enters-fifth-day-IDF-arrests-41-in-night-operation-359593 |title=Search for kidnapped boys enters fifth day, IDF arrests 41 in night operation |newspaper=The Jerusalem Post |date=17 June 2014}} The IDF shifted its attentions north, and deployed 1,000 soldiers from the [[Nahal Brigade]] for operations around [[Nablus]]. In particular the [[Balata]] refugee camp and the village of [[Awarta]] were scoured in what a spokesman called '"cleaning house" in the "terror capital of Nablus"', and a further 41 Palestinians were detained, among them the manager of the Hamas-run television channel [[Al-Aqsa TV]], bringing the number of arrests to 200. Israeli soldiers confiscated a large cache of weapons and uncovered a weapons manufacturing lab in Nablus.{{cite news |url=http://www.cbn.com/cbnnews/insideisrael/2014/June/IDF-Uncovers-Weapons-Caches-in-Nablus/ |title=IDF Uncovers Weapons Caches in Search for Teens |publisher=CBN |newspaper=News |date=17 June 2014}} Conflicting reports emerged on Israel's collaboration with both the PNA and other regional governments. Israel's [[Coordinator of Government Activities in the Territories]], [[Yoav Mordechai]], denied on 16 June that Israel coordinated the search with Palestinian or Egyptian authorities. However, Israel military intelligence confirmed that Israel was working closely with both the PA authorities and Egypt. Egyptian sources stated the same day that Israel had requested their assistance, and that President [[Abdel Fattah el-Sisi]] had issued directives to his security services to undertake negotiations with all parties.{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx%3FID%3D705243 |title=Sources: Israel asked Egypt to help find kidnapped teens |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=16 June 2014}} On 17 June, Israel defence sources said PNA assistance had been "very professional". ====Day 6==== [[File:Brother's Keeper Operation in Judea & Samaria (14447696321).jpg|thumb|IDF troops in the West Bank on the night of 18 June.]] On the night of 18 June, Israel seized a further 64 Palestinians, of whom 51 were Hamas members who had been previously arrested but released in the [[Gilad Shalit]] exchange in 2011, bringing to 240 the number of arrests. In six days, the government sources announced, they had searched 800 structures, including the Al-Aqsa radio station in Ramallah and the Hebron-based TransMedia communications company, both linked to Hamas.{{cite news |first=Yoav |last=Zitun |url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4531672,00.html |title=IDF arrests 51 prisoners released in Shalit deal |publisher=[[Ynetnews]] |date=18 June 2014}} They were taken in operations in Hebron, Jenin, Nablus, Yatta, Taffuh, Dura, Beit Kahil, [[East Jerusalem]], [[Idhna]], [[Surif]], [[Beit Ula]], [[Beit Awwa]], [[Deir Sharaf]], [[Salfit]], [[Tell, Nablus|Audla]], [[Tell, Nablus|Tell]], [[Beit Furik]]{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=705707 |title=Israeli army arrests over 50 Palestinians released in Shalit deal |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=18 June 2014}} and [[Qabatiya]].{{cite news |first1=Aron |last1=Donzis |first2=Spencer |last2=Ho |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/israel-scoops-up-51-palestinians-freed-under-shalit-deal/ |title=Israel scoops up 51 Palestinians freed under Shalit deal |newspaper=[[The Times of Israel]] |date=18 June 2014}} The overnight operations also secured the defenses of Israeli settlements. However, in the process 300,000 Palestinians were left under curfew, 600,000 in the area had their movements restricted,{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=706384 |title=UN Mideast peace envoy condemns Israel's arrest campaign |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=20 June 2014}} and Hebronites with permission to work in Israel, an estimated 20,000,{{cite news|url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx%3FID%3D706421|title=Hebron losses '$10m daily' during siege |work=[[Ma'an News Agency]]|date= 20 June 2014}} were denied entrance into Israel and thus their livelihood, and, according to an IDF spokesmen, Palestinians preparing for the [[Ramadan]] holiday have "taken a hit." [[Home Front Defense Ministry|Home Front Defense Minister]] [[Gilad Erdan]] also stated that Israel had identified the Hamas cell responsible for the kidnapping. ====Day 7==== Overnight on 19 June, troops raided the [[Bir Zeit University]]'s student union searching for incriminating evidence, finding promotional material for Hamas.{{cite news |first=Marissa |last=Newman |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/waiting-for-the-boys/ |title=Waiting for the boys |newspaper=[[The Times of Israel]] |date=20 June 2014}} The Prime Minister declared at a press conference: "We know more today than we did a few days ago." The IDF arrested 25 wanted Palestinians in the West Bank, and searched 200 homes. Nine more raids were launched against Hamas social services (Dawah) centers.{{cite news |url=http://www.jpost.com/Operation-Brothers-Keeper/Israel-vows-to-tighten-ring-around-kidnappers-as-it-targets-Hamas-infrastructure-360055 |title=Israel vows to 'tighten ring around kidnappers' as it targets Hamas infrastructure |newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]] |date=20 June 2014}} Moshe Ya'alon outlawed West Bank activities of the British Muslim charity, [[Islamic Relief|Islamic Relief Worldwide (IRW)]] because some of its offices employed Hamas members. In East Jerusalem, a social centre operated from a [[Beit Safafa]] mosque in Beit Safafa village, and a [[Sur Baher]] charity were also closed down.{{cite news |url=http://www.afp.com/en/news/30-new-arrests-israel-presses-west-bank-hunt-teens |archive-url=https://archive.is/20140620202536/http://www.afp.com/en/news/30-new-arrests-israel-presses-west-bank-hunt-teens |dead-url=yes |archive-date=20 June 2014 |title=30 new arrests as Israel presses West Bank hunt for teens |publisher=AFP |date=20 June 2014 }} By night's end, 49 Palestinians had been arrested. One of the refugee camp detainees complained that soldiers had stolen $580 from his wallet.{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=706367 |title=Israel detains 49 in large-scale West Bank arrest raids |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=20 June 2014}} ===Week 2 (20–26 June)=== [[File:Mohammed Dudin funeral 2.JPG|thumbnail|The funeral of 15-year-old Mohammed Dudeen, killed by the IDF in Dura during operation Brother's Keeper, June 2014]] ====Day 8==== Throughout the week, the arrest of Hamas leaders went quietly as they acceded to their detention, but by Friday, 20 June, sporadic popular resistance began to emerge. Three Palestinians were wounded in a raid on [[Kalandia|Qalandiya refugee camp]], near Jerusalem, while another five were wounded in clashes at the [[Dheisheh|Dheisheh refugee camp]] by [[Bethlehem]], whose Ibdaa cultural center was wrecked, cheques and money from its safe, together with five computers, confiscated.{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=706572 |title=Israeli forces raid Ibdaa cultural center in Bethlehem |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=22 June 2014}} Four of the victims were reportedly run over by an Israeli jeep.{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=706303 |title=5 injured, 30 detained as Israeli forces storm Duheisha camp |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=20 June 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=706303 |title=5 injured, 30 detained as Israeli forces storm Duheisha camp |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=20 June 2014 |quote=Medical sources said that Malek Mustafa al-Sharif, 22, was wounded by rubber-coated steel bullets during the clashes. In addition, an Israeli military patrol vehicle ran over four youths from the camp, including Musa al-Khamour, 22, Hassan Mujahid Abu Joudah, and Marcel Mahmoud Zaghout, 19, who was arrested after he was struck in the head by the vehicle. The fourth injured individual was not immediately identified.}} Also on 20 June, Israeli soldiers near the Qalandiya checkpoint in Ramallah fired live rounds at a group of Palestinians who had thrown homemade grenades at them. Mustafa Hosni Aslan, 22, received a gunshot wound to the head, and died on 25 June.{{cite news |last=Booth |first=William |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/israel-troops-kill-2-palestinians-during-search-for-israeli-students-in-occupied-west-bank/2014/06/20/571b0472-5c98-4098-8f19-31121359b3a2_story.html |title=Israeli troops kill 2 Palestinians during search for Israeli students in occupied West Bank |work =The Washington Post |date=17 June 2014 |accessdate=21 June 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=706357 |title=2nd Palestinian youth dies after being shot by Israeli forces |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=20 June 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=707843 |title=Palestinian shot Friday succumbs to wounds |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=25 June 2014}} Live fire was used according to the IDF in response to [[Molotov cocktail]]s, [[pipe bomb]]s, one makeshift grenade, firecrackers, and stones being thrown at soldiers at the camps.{{cite news |first1=Elior |last1=Levy |first2=Yoav |last2=Zitun |url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4532572,00.html |title=Palestinian teen said killed in clashes with IDF as army arrests 25 more suspects in West Bank |publisher=[[Ynetnews]] |date=20 June 2014}} In [[Dura, Hebron|Dura]]'s Haninia neighbourhood, after a night-long raid, involving many clashes with local youths, to detain a person Israelis consider to be a terrorist, as troops were withdrawing, eyewitness testimonies reported that a retreating Israeli soldier fired six shots and killed{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=706295 |title=13-year-old Palestinian shot dead by Israeli forces in Dura |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=20 June 2014}} 15-year-old Mohammed Dudeen.{{cite news |first=Jodi |last=Rudoren |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/06/21/world/middleeast/israeli-troops-kill-palestinian-teenager-protesting-west-bank-arrests.html |title=Israeli Troops Kill Palestinian Teenager Protesting West Bank Arrests |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |date=20 June 2014 |quote='One of them crouched and opened fire on the boy,' said Bassam al-Awadeh, 42, who said he watched from about {{convert |150|yd|m}} away. 'The boy was hit in his heart and his abdomen.'}}{{cite news |title=Palestinian killed in students hunt |url =http://www.independent.ie/world-news/palestinian-killed-in-students-hunt-30370736.html|agency= AP|work =Irish Independent|date= 20 June 2014}}{{cite news |first1=Gideon |last1=Levy |author1-link=Gideon Levy |first2=Alec |last2=Levac |url=http://www.haaretz.com/weekend/twilight-zone/.premium-1.601500 |title=The Palestinian teen whose death went unnoticed by Israel |newspaper=[[Haaretz]] |date=28 June 2014 |quote=The first group of soldiers made do with firing tear-gas and stun grenades at the large numbers of young people on the streets. A little after 5 A.M., the last group of soldiers started to leave the town. Suddenly, one of the soldiers in the rear of the column aimed his rifle and fired live ammunition at the youngsters, at a range of about 80 meters.}} Twenty-five more Palestinians were arrested at Dura and Dheisheh, bringing the number of detainees to 320, of which 240 are considered Hamas operatives. The number of sites searched mounted to 1,150, of which 1,000 buildings were damaged, the figure including over 750 homes. According to Palestinian Foreign Minister [[Riyad al-Malki]] Israel had destroyed 150 homes by week's end. In another dawn raid on the Dean's Office and Student Union of the [[Arab American University]] in Jenin papers were seized, and Amir Saadi, 17, was shot in the shoulder. The villages of [[Arraba, Jenin|Arraba]],{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=706311 |title=Israeli forces raid Arab American University in Jenin |newspaper=Ma'an |date=20 June 2014}} [[Al-Louz]], and [[Artas, Bethlehem|Artas]] were also raided. Riyad al-Malki demanded Israel produce evidence that Hamas was culpable, stating that Netanyahu cannot "keep blaming one side without showing evidence." He said Israel's massive military sweeps were unacceptable, with 300 Palestinians taken in exchange for three Israeli kids, but the Palestinian authority would act to prevent an [[uprising]], for "if the situation continues as it is, this will end up (with) the destruction of what we have built in Palestine."{{cite news |agency=[[Agence France-Presse|AFP]] |url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4532646,00.html |title=Palestinian FM: Israel overreacting on abducted teens |publisher=[[Ynetnews]] news |date=20 June 2014}} On Friday night, Israeli security spokesmen said the "noose was tightening" as troops were concentrated near Hebron, with intelligence officials confident that attempts to move the youths to either Jordan, Gaza, or the Sinai had failed.{{cite news |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/noose-tightening-around-kidnappers-teens-still-in-west-bank/ |title=Noose tightening around kidnappers, teens still in West Bank |newspaper=[[The Times of Israel]] |date=20 June 2014}} A spokesman for the Prime Minister, Amos Gilead, stated that Netanyahu's view that Hamas was responsible was "built on the base of firm intelligence." IDF forces ransacked Bethlehem's biggest Islamic charity, devoted to orphan's care, in the [[Bethlehem|Jabal al-Mawalih neighborhood]] and took away computers and files.{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=706458 |title=Israeli troops raid Bethlehem's biggest charitable society |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=21 June 2014}} ====Day 9==== On 21 June, Israeli forces concentrated their investigations on villages north of Hebron, searching wells, pits, and houses.{{cite news |first=Yoav |last=Zitun |url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4532701,00.html |title=IDF surrounds villages near Hebron, increases troop presence |publisher=[[Ynetnews]] |date=21 June 2014}} According to Palestinian reports, an elderly man, Ali Abed Jabir, either died during an altercation with Israeli troops who broke into his home while ransacking houses in the village of [[Haris, Salfit|Haris]], or was denied passage for medical treatment after suffering a heart attack.{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=706454 |title=Palestinian man dies of heart attack as Israeli troops raid home |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=20 June 2014}} Israel sources state the house was not raided and, on being told of the heart-attack, an Israeli ambulance was called.{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=706562 |title=Israel rejects responsibility for elderly Palestinian's death |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=21 June 2014}} A further 39 Palestinians, primarily in Hebron and Bethlehem, were arrested in overnight raids, bringing the number seized to roughly 370, 75 of whom had been released in the 2011 prisoner swap. IDF sources challenged the report, saying only 10 Hamas 'terrorists' were seized. Further claims of soldiers stealing money were made by villagers in Beit Kahil.{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=706487 |title=Ongoing arrest campaign brings total Palestinians in jail to 5,700 |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=21 June 2014 |quote=Two residents of the village also accused Israeli troops of stealing money from their homes during predawn raids Saturday. Samir Haymouni told Ma'an that Israeli troops stole 15,000 shekels ($4,300) in addition to damaging all of his furniture. Similarly, Hatim Asafra said that Israeli soldiers stole 2,500 shekels ($725) from his apartment.}} In the village of [[al-Bireh]], several houses were ransacked, and soldiers broke into the Noon Center for Islamic Studies and the Palmedia TC company where they confiscated computers and damaged furniture.{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=706456 |title=Israeli forces storm al-Bireh, clash with young men |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=21 June 2014}} The IDF said cash had been confiscated in 21 homes of the 146 homes searched overnight.{{cite news |first=Yoav |last=Zitun |url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4532764,00.html |title=Rescue units rushed to Hebron, searching wells and caves |publisher=[[Ynetnews]] |date=21 June 2014}} Palestinian sources also stated that in a predawn raid in Nablus, a female reporter was assaulted and troops shot and injured two Palestinian teenagers.{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=706481 |title=3 Palestinians injured in overnight Israeli raids in Nablus |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=21 June 2014}} In the late afternoon three fire trucks, with pumps to empty pools of water, and an ATV rescue unit were rushed to assist special forces searching an area riddled with caves and wells north of Hebron, between [[Highway 35 (Israel)|Highway 35]] and [[Highway 60 (Israel)|Highway 60]], reportedly without concrete intelligence leads. Netanyahu reaffirmed that 'the information in Israel's hands unequivocally indicates that Hamas is responsible for the abduction of the youths.' ====Day 10==== [[File:Street in Ramallah after IDF raid during Operation Brother’s Keeper June 2014 2.jpg|thumb|Street in Ramallah after IDF raid during Operation Brother's Keeper, June 2014]] On 22 June, Israeli units shot dead two Palestinians and wounded another 11 in overnight clashes in Ramallah and Nablus, while nine (Israeli statistic) to 38 (Palestinian statistic){{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=706760 |title=38 detained in West Bank raids on Sunday, bringing total above 400 |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=22 June 2014}}. The list notes 16 from Hebron, 19 from Bethlehem and three from Jenin. were arrested and five charity offices were raided. Israeli forces also raided [[Abu Dis]] and [[Al-Quds University]]'s law faculty, seizing flags and several computers.{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=706679 |title=Israeli forces raid Al-Quds University |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=22 June 2014}} Ahmad Said Suod Khalid (27), an epileptic,{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=706854 |title=PCHR condemns army killing of mentally disabled man |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=22 June 2014}} of [[Ein Beit al-Ma']] refugee camp was shot in the abdomen, back, and thigh,{{cite news |first=Jodi |last=Rudoren |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/06/23/world/middleeast/israel-syria-border-attack.html |title=Israeli Youth Dies in Attack Near Syrian Border |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |date=22 June 2014}} for refusing an order to turn back as he insisted on going to a mosque for dawn prayers. Muhammad Ismail Atallah Tarifi (30) was found dead on the roof of a building opposite an Israeli sniper position,{{cite news |first=Yoav |last=Zitun |url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4532948,00.html |title=Two Palestinians killed during clashes with IDF, nine arrested overnight |publisher=[[Ynetnews]] |date=22 June 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=706668 |title=Israeli forces kill 2 Palestinians in Ramallah and Nablus overnight |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=22 June 2014}} an autopsy found he was shot dead by an [[M16 rifle|M16]], a rifle in use with the IDF.{{cite news |title=Two Palestinians, one Israeli boy killed in separate clashes|url=http://www.latimes.com/world/middleeast/la-fg-palestinians-dead-clashes-west-bank-20140622-story.html|work=The Los Angeles Times|date= 22 June 2014}}{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=706789 |title=Autopsy proves slain Palestinian killed by Israeli fire in Ramallah |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=22 June 2014}} Mourners at his funeral in al-Bireh later complained that settlers from [[Psagot]] had fired at them, injuring one.{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=706919 |title=Israeli settlers open fire at mourners in Ramallah, 1 hurt |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=22 June 2014}} Palestinians, protesting at the cooperation given Israeli forces by their own police, who dispersed crowds by firing live ammunition in the air, smashed four local police cars in Ramallah, and, once Israelis had withdrawn from the city, raided a police station in [[Al Manara Square]]. Abbas, affirming that he was not convinced Hamas was responsible, called on Netanyahu to condemn two earlier killings, and asked if the criminal kidnapping justified 'the killing of Palestinian youth in cold blood?'{{cite news |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/abbas-calls-on-netanyahu-to-condemn-palestinian-deaths/ |title=Abbas calls on Netanyahu to condemn Palestinian deaths |newspaper=[[The Times of Israel]] |date=22 June 2014}} The Palestinian Prisoners' Society named 420 people so far arrested, claimed Israel consistently understated the numbers and refused to disclose where they are detained. On Sunday, the Palestinian Authority asked for an urgent convening of the [[UN Security Council]], while mulling an appeal both to the [[Fourth Geneva Convention|High Contracting Parties of the Fourth Geneva Convention]] and the [[UN General Assembly]] to put an end what it considered to be "collective punishment," "Israeli terrorist aggression against the [[State of Palestine]]," and what [[Hanan Ashrawi]] termed "a reign of terror directed against a captive Palestinian population."{{cite news |first=Elhanan |last=Miller |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/palestinians-turning-to-un-security-council-to-halt-west-bank-raids/ |title=Palestinians Turning to UN Security Council to Halt West Bank Raids |newspaper=[[The Times of Israel]] |date=22 June 2014}} ====Day 11==== On 23 June, 80 locations, including seven Hamas-linked charities, were raided from the Nablus to Hebron and Jenin areas, with a further 37 Palestinians detained overnight. Four money-changing shops in Hebron and one in Bethlehem were also searched, and their computers confiscated. The number of Palestinians under detention rose to 471.{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=706979 |title=Israel detains 37 Palestinians as arrest operation continues |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=23 June 2014}} An officer interviewed on [[Walla!]] said that Israel, having achieved most of its "band of targets", would close the operation, and that the military incursion pattern in the West Bank, apart from detention raids, would stop within days.
